result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle J Seger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).
  • Intimidate Victim/Dissuade Reporting [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.44(1).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
No abusive contact with Jerold or Cindy Seger.
Write letters of apology to Jerold and Cindy Seger and provide to the agent within the first 30 days to approve.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Kyle J Seger
Current: 2205 Division Street, Stevens Point, WI 54481 United States  (Effective: 03-02-2015)
Prior: 325 Hoover Ave., Plover, WI 54467
Revoked - Sentence to County Jail/HOC on 1/23/15

Defendant Kyle J Seger in court with attorney Anne Renc. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
State files Amended Information. 
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.  The victim is present but would not like to make a statement. 
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.  Received a copy of the amended information and waives its reading. 

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Counts 1, 2 & 3 of the amended information - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorney stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty counts 1, 2 & 3.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 4 is dismissed and read-in. 

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Renc makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Court questions defendant. 

BY THE COURT: 
Count 1 
Serve 75 days jail with 2 days credit - STAYED
Huber if approved by jail administration. 
Placed on probation for a period of 24 months:
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Mental Health Assessment and comply with treatment recommendations. 
No abusive contact with Jerold Seger or Cindy Seger. 
Write letters of apology to them and provide to agent within the first 30 days to approve. 
Pay costs, including the DNA surcharge. 

Count 2: 
Serve 75 days jail with 2 days credit - STAYED, concurrent
Huber if approved by jail administration. 
Placed on probation for a period of 24 months, concurrent:
Comply with all conditions set forth in Count 1. 
Pay costs, including the Domestic Abuse and DNA surcharges. 

Count 3:
Serve 75 days jail with 2 days credit - STAYED, concurrent
Huber if approved by jail administration. 
Placed on probation for a period of 24 months, concurrent. 
Comply with conditions set forth in Count 1. 
Pay costs, including the Domestic Abuse and DNA surcharges.

Arraignment on September 23, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Plea hearing on September 23, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Plea hearing on September 23, 2014 at 10:30 a.m.

Matter was to be heard in Br 2, but was moved to Br 3. Matter rescheduled.  Preliminary hearing and Arraignment scheduled for September 23, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
***Court recalls case at 3:28 p.m. as Atty Renc has appeared. Atty Renc states a written prelim waiver was filed and discussed with ADA prior to court and let the Defendant go.
 Court has receives and accepts the written waiver.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 
  

Next court date is already set for a plea hearing.  Matter will also be set for an arraignment.
allowing contact filed by Jerold and Cindy Seger
CAP Services: Personalized Family Safety Plan filed by Cindy Seger
CAP Services: Personalized Family Safety Plan filed by Jerold Seger
Preliminary hearing on August 25, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Kyle J Seger in court with attorney Anne Renc. Intern Krause w/Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 25, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription  and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
  Report alcohol and drug free to the Day Report Center no less than the following times per week:  *3 times per week
Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  *Cindy or Jerold Seger  *Unless a written request  from the victim and a Family Safety Plan is filed with the District Attorney and the Clerk of Courts.  If filed, then no abusive contact with the above named.

*8/4/14 Family Safety plans and Letter allowing contact filed by Jerold and Cindy Seger*

ADA Cass Cousins appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.
Atty Anne Renc appears in Court. 

ADA Cousins states facts for anticipated charges of Disorderly Conduct.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

State requests a $500 cash bond with conditions as stated.
Atty Renc indicates defendant does qualify and an attorney will be appointed.  Makes arguments for bond. 
Atty Renc questions the defendant re: where he will reside. 

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  8/4/14  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 1
